name: The Saint Strikes Back
description: The Saint Strikes Back is a movie starring George Sanders, Wendy Barrie, and Jonathan Hale. Simon Templar, the Saint, travels to San Francisco to solve crime mysteries within the police department.
keywords: shot in the back,the saint character,simon templar character,four word title,monkey

review.name: Compared to other Saint series films, this one is mighty dull and uninspiring
review.reviewBody: I love B-detective series films like Charlie Chan, Sherlock Holmes and The Falcon. Sure, they are mighty predictable, but there is also a certain charm and sense of fun about them that is hard to beat. While the Saint series is not my favorite, I have always enjoyed them because I love seeing George Sanders so gracefully navigate himself through the mystery--he was the epitome of cool and sophisticated. Because of this, I often find myself watching the film for his performance but caring little for the actual mystery (so many of them seem similar). However, in this dull effort, I just couldn't get past the lifeless plot and lack of decent supporting characters. Compared to most of the other films in this series, this might just be the worst, though I did appreciate how the film made reference to the prior film (starring Louis Hayward)--giving the film a sense of continuity and context. Now this isn't to say it's bad--but unfortunately, it is only a time-passer and not a whole lot more.
